N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 16, ch. V, subch. E, art. 2, pt. 577 - Instructions-water Plant Accounts

State Regulations
§ 577.1 - Water plant to be recorded at original cost
§ 577.2 - Additions and retirements of water plant
§ 577.3 - Components of construction cost
§ 577.4 - Work order system required (class c utilities only)
§ 577.5 - Transfers of property
§ 577.6 - Expenditures on property leased for use in water operations

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 16, ch. V, subch. E, art. 2, pt. 577

Amounts received for construction which are ultimately to
be refunded, wholly or in part, shall be credited to account 1241, Customer

Advances for Construction. When the amount to be refunded has been finally
determined, the balance, if any, remaining in account 1241 shall be debited
thereto and credited to the water plant accounts to which the cost of the
property was charged. The cost of property includes the cost of preliminary
surveys and studies and the cost of preparing plans and specifications at the
time of construction for construction projects which are undertaken, and also
the cost of keeping the construction accounts during the construction period, together with the cost of maps, books, files and other systems employed and
permanently preserved in support of such construction costs. The cost of
property does not include the cost incurred subsequent to the construction
period of preparing, installing or maintaining maps, inventories, accounting
and other financial records of property for use in the operation of a
constructed plant, the cost of the preparation of inventories, appraisals, or
other studies, nor costs incurred in the establishment or revision of
accounting routine. Requirement of the use of the work order system here
outlined may be suspended by order of the commission in the case of a utility
which satisfies the commission that the system which it has in use for
recording changes in water plant accounts gives the equivalent detail by
accounts in substantially the same form. The identification of expenditures
with property must be complete and clear, and the detail of the cost of each
project or job must be readily
available. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
